overview:
As Founder and Director of BioMimicryNYC, Adiel Gavish is working to connect and cultivate a community of biomimicry practice in the New York City metro region.

Biomimicry is innovation inspired by nature. It is a science that studies nature’s best sustainable solutions and applies them to solve man-made challenges. From a technological perspective, the natural world is a consultant with 3.8 billion years of experience in R&D.

The BNYC network is a consortium of professionals working with the international Biomimicry 3.8 group, as well as a global network of organizations to scale the application of nature-inspired design. Dubbed “the next frontier of sustainability”, Biomimicry is a science, an ethos that reveals what is possible when we look to nature as a source of good ideas rather than a warehouse of goods.

Previously, as a consultant to Yoxi.tv, Adiel worked to build strategic partnerships between social innovators, including entrepreneurs, intrapraneurs, businesses and non profit organizations.

Ms. Gavish was also the director of a non profit environmental advocacy organization for 7 years, spearheading grassroots efforts in clean air and water, open space conservation and sustainable business.
